intro: Hibbertia florida subsp. angustinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with red stamens. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and have a prominent midrib, contributing to its botanical classification. Hibbertia florida subsp. angustinervis is often found in coastal and inland regions of New South Wales and Victoria.
